page.title: 19Local History 2
page.content: Mr Edward Stables remembers the corn mill working down Mill Lane. I remember the carts of grain passing the old pub and one particular windy day, the sails blew off the mill. At the clay workings in 1929 bricks were made by hand and in later years land drainage tiles were made. I remember the Zeppelin raids of 1914/18 and a nearby barn's slate roof shattered by a hail of brass balls. In the second world war German prisoners were brought from Howden to work on the farm. The children asked me what was the best day in my life and I couldn't think of anything to tell them. After they'd gone I thought about it and decided the best day of my life was the day I threw my cigarettes away.
